message.content:
cs.IR, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.CL 

The paper discusses machine learning and data mining techniques used in hybrid music recommender systems. The focus is on the interaction of users with large music catalogs, which suggests the paper could belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category. The use of data mining techniques also suggests the paper could belong to the Software Development (cs.SD) sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of robust techniques for the "cold-start problem," which could fall under the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The analysis of playlist characteristics and song feature representations could also fall under the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category. Finally, the paper's focus on playlist continuation and the relationship between playlists and songs could suggest the paper belongs to the Computation and Language (cs.CL) sub-category.
